statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: John Holland scored 27 points and Boston University rallied from a 16-point halftime deficit to defeat Albany (N.Y.) 70-67 on Saturday night.
article.headline: BU comes from behind for win against Albany
article.linkText: BU comes from behind for win against Albany
article.story: ALBANY, N.Y. -- John Holland scored 27 points and Boston University rallied from a 16-point halftime deficit to defeat Albany (N.Y.) 70-67 on Saturday night. The Terriers earned their first three-game win streak of the season and snapped an eight-game road skid dating back to last season. BU (8-10, 3-1 America East Conference) trailed 38-22 at halftime as the Great Danes shot 51.7 percent from the field (15 of 29) with no turnovers. The Terriers took their first lead at 56-55 on a Darryl Partin 3-pointer with 5:31 left. After Albany (8-12, 1-4) regained the lead with a Logan Aronhalt 3, Jeff Pelange's three-point play gave BU the lead for good. The Terriers shot 59.1 percent from the floor (13 of 22) and made 17 of 21 free throws in the second half. Holland hit six 3-pointers and Partin had 11 of his 16 points in the second half. Tim Ambrose's 18 points led the Great Danes.
